title: Synthetic Recap
body:
PHOENIX (AP) — It was a clinic, a masterpiece, and a coronation all rolled into one. In a hostile environment against the Phoenix Suns, Hakeem Olajuwon didn’t just lead his Houston Rockets to a 110-95 victory; he authored one of the most breathtaking individual performances the game has ever seen.

"The Dream" was a waking nightmare for Phoenix, scoring a career-high and franchise-record 49 points. He was unstoppable, a whirlwind of spins, fakes, and feathery touches around the basket. The Suns threw every body they had at him, but Olajuwon’s footwork was a blur and his arsenal was limitless. Each possession was a lesson in post-graduate basketball, leaving defenders grasping at air as another graceful jump-hook or thunderous dunk found the net.

While Olajuwon’s scoring was historic, his dominance was holistic. He controlled the glass with 13 rebounds, anchored the defense with 7 crucial blocks, and even dished out 5 assists, punishing the Suns whenever they dared to double-team him. He was the sun around which the entire Rockets’ universe revolved.

The Suns, led by Kevin Johnson’s 19 points and 13 assists, fought valiantly but were simply overmatched by a force of nature. Charles Barkley added 18 points, but it was a mere footnote on a night belonging to Olajuwon.

This was more than a regular-season win; it was a statement. In an era of giants, Hakeem Olajuwon stood tallest, delivering a performance so profound it etched his name not just into the Rockets' record book, but into the eternal annals of NBA history.
